org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_ximgproc

Class DisparityWLSFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer
      • org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_core.Algorithm
        • org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_ximgproc.DisparityFilter
          • org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_ximgproc.DisparityWLSFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    @Namespace(value="cv::ximgproc")
 @Properties(inherit=opencv_ximgproc.class)
public class DisparityWLSFilter
extends DisparityFilter
    \brief Disparity map filter based on Weighted Least Squares filter (in form of Fast Global Smoother that is a lot faster than traditional Weighted Least Squares filter implementations) and optional use of left-right-consistency-based confidence to refine the results in half-occlusions and uniform areas.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer

    • Method Detail

      • getLambda

        public double getLambda()
        \brief Lambda is a parameter defining the amount of regularization during filtering. Larger values force filtered disparity map edges to adhere more to source image edges. Typical value is 8000.

      • setLambda

        public void setLambda(double _lambda)
        See Also:
        getLambda

      • getSigmaColor

        public double getSigmaColor()
        \brief SigmaColor is a parameter defining how sensitive the filtering process is to source image edges. Large values can lead to disparity leakage through low-contrast edges. Small values can make the filter too sensitive to noise and textures in the source image. Typical values range from 0.8 to 2.0.

      • setSigmaColor

        public void setSigmaColor(double _sigma_color)
        See Also:
        getSigmaColor

      • getLRCthresh

        public int getLRCthresh()
        \brief LRCthresh is a threshold of disparity difference used in left-right-consistency check during confidence map computation. The default value of 24 (1.5 pixels) is virtually always good enough.

      • setLRCthresh

        public void setLRCthresh(int _LRC_thresh)
        See Also:
        getLRCthresh

      • getDepthDiscontinuityRadius

        public int getDepthDiscontinuityRadius()
        \brief DepthDiscontinuityRadius is a parameter used in confidence computation. It defines the size of low-confidence regions around depth discontinuities.

      • setDepthDiscontinuityRadius

        public void setDepthDiscontinuityRadius(int _disc_radius)
        See Also:
        getDepthDiscontinuityRadius

      • getConfidenceMap

        @ByVal
public Mat getConfidenceMap()
        \brief Get the confidence map that was used in the last filter call. It is a CV_32F one-channel image with values ranging from 0.0 (totally untrusted regions of the raw disparity map) to 255.0 (regions containing correct disparity values with a high degree of confidence).

      • getROI

        @ByVal
public Rect getROI()
        \brief Get the ROI used in the last filter call
